column1: Your kidneys' main job is to remove toxins and extra fluid from your blood.
Kidney dialysis (peritoneal dialysis and other types of dialysis) does some of the job of the kidneys when they stop working well.
Your doctor will perform surgery to place the catheter in your abdomen where it will stay.
You and your caregivers must learn how to: - Perform PD as prescribed - Use the equipment - Buy and keep track of supplies - Prevent infection With PD, it is important not to skip exchanges.

Depending on the results, you may need to make certain adjustments: - To do more exchanges per day - To use more cleansing fluid at each exchange - To decrease the dwell time so you absorb less sugar WHEN TO START DIALYSIS Kidney failure is the last stage of chronic kidney disease.
There is a risk for infection of the peritoneum (peritonitis) or the catheter site with PD.
